pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:5.1: 52. The training rule on abusing monks
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Vesālī in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.2: At that time Venerable Upāli’s preceptor, Venerable Kappita, was staying in a charnel ground.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.3: Just then the leader of the nuns from the group of six had died.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.4: They took her to the charnel ground, cremated her near Venerable Kappita’s dwelling, and made a stupa. They then went there and cried.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.5: Venerable Kappita was disturbed by the noise, and so he demolished the stupa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.6: The nuns from the group of six thought,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.7: “This Kappita has demolished our Venerable’s stupa; let’s kill him,” and they made a plan.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.8: A certain nun told Venerable Upāli what had happened,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.9: and he in turn told Venerable Kappita.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.10: Venerable Kappita then left his dwelling and hid himself.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.11: Soon afterwards the nuns from the group of six went to his dwelling
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:6.12: and crushed it with rocks and clods of earth. And when they thought he was dead, they left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:7.1: The following morning Venerable Kappita robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Vesālī for almsfood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:7.2: When the nuns from the group of six saw him,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:7.4: “This Kappita is alive! Who foiled our plan?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:8.2: that Venerable Upāli had foiled it,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:8.4: “How can this barber, this dirt-remover of inferior birth, foil our plan?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:9.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:9.3: “How can the nuns from the group of six abuse Venerable Upāli?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:9.4: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:9.7: How can the nuns from the group of six abuse Venerable Upāli?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:9.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:9.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:10.1: ‘If a nun abuses or reviles a monk, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:11.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:12.4: if she abuses with the ten kinds of abuse or with any one of them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:13.2: if she does what is fear-inducing, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:14.1: If he is fully ordained, and she perceives him as such, and she abuses or reviles him, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:14.2: If he is fully ordained, but she is unsure if he is, and she abuses or reviles him, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:14.3: If he is fully ordained, but she does not perceive him as such, and she abuses or reviles him, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:15.1: If she abuses or reviles someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:15.2: If he is not fully ordained, but she perceives him as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:15.3: If he is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:15.4: If he is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive him as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:16.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:17.1: The second training rule is finished.
